result.execSummary:
The defendant Nichole M. Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nichole M. Butler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nichole M. Butler was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:23 p.m. Defendant Nichole M. Butler in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer states agreement - Cirilli concurs. State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 1 - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. State movs to dismiss 16cf25 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant pleads no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Parties stipulate there is a factual basis for complaint. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Discussion concerning defendant's change of residence and potential bail jumping charges - State is in agreement not to charge at this time. Pfeifer/Cirilli/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 18 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Must comply with all Social Services or CHIPS orders.
Jail credit - 2 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Appeal rights given. Costs to paid from cash bond posted - Attorney Cirilli assignment to be paid - any balance refunded to poster.
